basic.description: Study of the techniques of Geographic Information Systems and their applications in solving physical and environmental problems. Topics include data representation and models, spatial interpolation, raster-based analysis and modeling, surface models and terrain analysis, data visualization, temporal analysis, error and accuracy, and other algorithms and analytical procedures.
basic.subject: GPHY
basic.title: Environmental Modelling

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Prerequisite    GPHY243 (or GISC201) and GPHY247, or permission of the Department.
Equivalency    GISC301
